main event: An observer sighted a solid silver light described as being approximately the brightness of a first magnitude star, moving southeast at about 8 degrees per second.
interesting points: The object resembled a satellite and was identified as ECHO II, The observer reported that the light was as bright as the stars, The sighting occurred in Vista, California, in 1958, The sighting was recorded and analyzed under Project Blue Book, The object was moving at a consistent speed with no erratic behavior.
witness description: The witness described the object as resembling a satellite with solid brightness.
